reviews.review_msg: The class itself was okay, there were only 4 things that were graded. TA's marked unfairly. reach out to the prof for help she was accessible and understanding.

This professor marked so hard and did not provide any feedback with any assignments. Do not take this class thinking it is a GPA booster because it is a lot of work. There were so many different assignments and a huge final worth 35 percent that was ridiculous and hard -also closed book. The lectures were also so long and kind of hard to understand

Took this class as a first-year student and would not recommend it. this professor is a GPA killer as she has the harshest marking I have ever seen! I got marks taken off for not being sincere enough on an assignment. also, the lectures are very boring and the final all we were told is to review all of our notes.

Through all my years at SFU so far this is the worst prof I have ever had. She does not want her students to succeed in this course and claims to get above a B it has to have 0 flaws. The content is not what you would expect from a geography course. Do not take this course if you don't need it, it will lower your GPA.

She is the worst professor I have dealt with at SFU. She was completely unprofessional and did not care if her students succeeded in the course. She did not give any feedback on assignments and she communicated in an extremely condescending tone. Her grading system was unfair and unprofessional. I would not recommend this class to any student.

Perhaps GEOG162 is Prof Roderick's better course because this online class was engaging, and the activities were fun if you are willing to make it fun. Other than that, I took this as a requirement, and I recommend it to anyone considering this course as her being the prof for it.

I loved taking this course with Dr, Roderick. She struggled a bit technology wise, but was super caring and engaging. You can tell she wants her students to succeed! I will definitely be taking more courses from her.
